title: Publications
text:
Center for Research on Systems Change in Public Health (CRSCPH) produces research, reports, and evidence designed to strengthen public health systems and advance equity. Our work spans social norms research, systems analysis, evaluation, and community-engage
This page highlights scholarly outputs from the Center and will continue to expand as new work is published and disseminated.

title: Publications
text:

Peer-reviewed articles will be added as they are released.

title: Publications
text:

Reports and briefs will be added as they are released.

title: Publications

title: Publications
text:

title: About the Center
text:
CRSCPH is a research and practice hub dedicated to advancing health equity by understandingâ€”and transformingâ€”the systems, structures, and social norms that shape population health and social well-being.
Public health challenges are rarely the result of individual behavior alone. They are produced by policies, institutions, power dynamics, and cultural norms that influence access, opportunity, and outcomes across communities. CRSCPH works at this intersection of research, practice, and policy to support systems-level change that is equitable, sustainable, and community-centered.
We bring together interdisciplinary research, social science expertise, and public health practice, partnering closely with communities and institutions to translate evidence into meaningful action.

title: About the Center
text:
CRSCPH is a research and practice hub dedicated to advancing health equity by understandingâ€”and transformingâ€”the systems, structures, and social norms that shape population health and social well-being.
Public health challenges are rarely the result of individual behavior alone. They are produced by policies, institutions, power dynamics, and cultural norms that influence access, opportunity, and outcomes across communities. CRSCPH works at this intersection of research, practice, and policy to support systems-level change that is equitable, sustainable, and community-centered.
We bring together interdisciplinary research, social science expertise, and public health practice, partnering closely with communities and institutions to translate evidence into meaningful action.

title: About the Center
text:
Our Mission
CRSCPH advances health equity and social change by translating research into action through rigorous evaluation, intervention design, social norms research, and leadership development. We partner with communities, organizations, and systems to transform the conditions that shape population health and social well-being.

title: About the Center
text:
Our Vision
A future where public health and social systems are just, responsive, and rooted in community wisdomâ€”producing equitable outcomes across generations.

title: About the Center
text:
Our Approach
Meaningful and lasting public health change requires more than programs. It requires shifting the systems and norms that shape decision-making, resource allocation, and lived experience. CRSCPH takes an integrated, equity-centered approach grounded in four core pillars:

Systems Change
We examine and address the policies, structures, and institutional practices that drive health inequities. Our work focuses on identifying leverage points within complex systems and supporting strategies that promote accountability, equity, and long-term transformation.


Social Norms Research
Social normsâ€”shared beliefs, expectations, and unwritten rulesâ€”play a powerful role in shaping behavior, service access, and health outcomes. CRSCPH applies social norms theory and behavioral science to understand how culture and context influence health, particularly for communities historically marginalized by public systems.


Equity and Inclusion
Equity is not an add-on; it is foundational to our work. We center lived experience as expertise and prioritize community partnership, co-design, and participatory approaches throughout research, evaluation, and implementation. Our work is trauma-informed, culturally responsive, and grounded in respect for community knowledge.


Translating Evidence Into Action
CRSCPH works alongside communities, agencies, and cross-sector partners to ensure research findings lead to practical solutions. This includes informing policy, improving programs, strengthening systems, and supporting leaders to apply evidence in real-world contexts.

title: About the Center
text:
What We Do
CRSCPH provides consulting and partnership support across three core areas:
Research, Evaluation, and Learning
We design and conduct equity-focused research and evaluation, using mixed methods to measure what matters and support continuous learning and improvement.
Intervention and Strategy Design
We support the development of theory-driven, community-informed interventions and systems-level strategies, including social norms change initiatives and policy-relevant solutions.
Leadership and Capacity Development
We work with leaders and organizations to strengthen equity-centered leadership, support organizational change, and build capacity for systems transformation.

title: About the Center
text:
What Makes CRSCPH Distinct

We intentionally bridge research and practice, ensuring evidence informs decision-making and action.
We integrate systems thinking with social norms theory to address root causesâ€”not just symptomsâ€”of inequity.
We prioritize culturally responsive, community-grounded approaches.
We focus on structural drivers of health outcomes, not solely individual behavior.
We support organizations seeking to reimagine how public health is designed, implemented, and led.

title: About the Center
text:
Our Work in Action
CRSCPH collaborates with state and local public health agencies, community-based organizations, academic partners, national research networks, foundations, and policy leaders. Through these partnerships, we support systems transformation, policy development, health equity research, and community-led change initiatives.

title: About the Center
text:
Connect With Us
CRSCPH welcomes partnerships, inquiries, and opportunities for collaboration. Whether you are seeking a research partner, evaluation support, or guidance on systems and norms change, we invite you to connect and explore how we can work together.
Email: robsan.tura@crscph.org

title: Home
section: Center for Research on Systems Change and Public Health (CRSCPH)
text:
Center for Research on Systems Change and Public Health (CRSCPH)
Evidence. Equity. Action.
CRSCPH is a public health and social change consulting firm advancing equity by transforming the systems, social norms, and leadership practices that shape population health. We bridge research, practice, and policy to support sustainable, community-centered change.

title: Home
text:
Who We Are
CRSCPH works alongside communities, public health agencies, and organizations to address the structural and cultural drivers of health inequities. Our work centers systems change, social norms research, and equity-informed leadership to move beyond individual-level solutions toward lasting transformation.

title: Home
text:
What We Do

Research, Evaluation & Learning

Equity-focused program and policy evaluation

Mixed-methods research design

Community-engaged data collection

Learning agendas and continuous improvement frameworks



Intervention & Strategy Design

Theory of Change and logic model development

Social norms and behavior change strategies

Community-informed intervention design

Policy and systems-level strategy development



Leadership & Capacity Development

Equity-centered leadership development

Systems and adaptive leadership coaching

Organizational culture and change support

Facilitation of cross-sector collaboratives

title: Home
text:
Systems Thinking & Systems Change

We apply systems thinking to help partners understand and address the complex, interconnected forces that shape population health. Our work supports organizations in moving beyond siloed interventions toward equitable, adaptive, and sustainable systems change. Our systems thinking and systems change services include:
Supporting understanding of social and structural determinants of health, including how policies, institutions, and power dynamics influence health outcomes
Examining political determinants of health, such as governance, policy processes, and decision-making structures that shape access, accountability, and resource allocation
Training on equitable systems change, equipping practitioners and leaders to apply systems thinking through an equity and justice lens
Training on the equitable use of artificial intelligence (AI) in public health, with attention to bias, ethics, governance, and responsible application in public systems
Applying systems change models and system characteristics, including leverage points, feedback loops, adaptation, and learning within complex public health systems

This work supports leaders, agencies, and communities to design strategies that address root causes, respond to complexity, and promote long-term transformation.

title: Home
text:
Our Work
CRSCPHâ€™s work spans peer-reviewed research, applied evaluation, strategy design, and leadership development across areas such as maternal and child health, gender equity, community health systems, and public sector transformation.
Visit the Publications page to explore our scholarly contributions and applied research.

title: Home
text:
Partner With Us
CRSCPH partners with public health agencies, community-based organizations, academic institutions, funders, and policy leaders seeking to strengthen systems, shift norms, and advance equity.
Learn more about our approach on the About page or connect with us through the Contact page.

title: Services
text:
The Center for Research on Systems Change in Public Health (CRSCPH) provides research, consultation, and strategic support to partners working to strengthen public health systems and advance health equity. Our services are grounded in rigorous evidence, systems science, community partnership, and culturally responsive practice.
We collaborate with government agencies, community-based organizations, academic institutions, foundations, and cross-sector partners to generate insight, build capacity, and support meaningful, sustainable transformation.

title: Services
text:
The Center for Research on Systems Change in Public Health (CRSCPH) provides research, consultation, and strategic support to partners working to strengthen public health systems and advance health equity. Our services are grounded in rigorous evidence, systems science, community partnership, and culturally responsive practice.
We collaborate with government agencies, community-based organizations, academic institutions, foundations, and cross-sector partners to generate insight, build capacity, and support meaningful, sustainable transformation.

title: Services
text:
Research, Evaluation & Learning
We conduct rigorous, equity-centered research and evaluation to understand how systems, structures, and social norms influence behavior, service access, health outcomes, and community resilience. Our work supports learning, accountability, and action across public health systems.
Our research and evaluation services include:

Equity-focused program and policy evaluation
Mixed-methods research design
Community-engaged and participatory research
Social norms and behavioral insights
Systems mapping and systems analysis
Equity impact assessments
Learning agendas and continuous improvement frameworks
Policy analysis and evidence translation

title: Services
text:
Intervention & Strategy Design
We support partners in designing theory-driven, community-informed interventions and systems-level strategies that address root causes of inequity and promote sustainable change.
Our intervention and strategy design services include:

Theory of Change and logic model development
Social norms and behavior change strategies
Community-informed and co-designed interventions
Policy- and systems-level strategy development
Public health systems strengthening and modernization

title: Services
text:
Leadership & Capacity Development
We work with leaders, teams, and organizations to build the skills and capacities needed to navigate complexity, lead equity-centered change, and transform organizational culture.
Our leadership and capacity development services include:

Equity-centered leadership development
Systems and adaptive leadership coaching
Organizational culture and change support
Facilitation of cross-sector collaboratives
Capacity-building cohorts and learning institutes

title: Services
text:
Strategic Consultation & Technical Assistance
We provide strategic consultation and technical assistance to agencies and organizations seeking to shift systems, strengthen equity, and improve public health outcomes.
Our consultation services include:

Systems transformation strategy
Organizational and structural analysis
Equity and inclusion frameworks
Social norms change strategy development
Cross-sector collaboration and alignment

title: Services
text:
Training & Learning
We offer training and learning experiences that equip teams and leaders with practical tools to apply systems thinking, social norms research, and equity principles in real-world public health contexts.
Training topics include:

Systems thinking for public health
Social norms theory and application
Health equity and structural determinants of health
Community engagement and co-design
Data storytelling and evidence communication
Implementation and change management

title: Services
text:
Community Partnership & Engagement
Community partnership is foundational to our work. We collaborate with communities to ensure research, strategies, and policies reflect lived experience, cultural context, and community priorities.
Our community engagement services include:

Co-design and participatory approaches
Community advisory structures
Qualitative and mixed-methods research
Culturally grounded engagement strategies
Narrative and norms-change initiatives

title: Services
text:
Policy Support & Evidence Translation
We help partners interpret research, apply evidence, and develop policies that promote equitable and effective outcomes.
Our policy support services include:

Policy analysis and systems impact assessment
Evidence syntheses, briefs, and reports
Legislative and regulatory insight
Strategic communication and messaging
Health equityâ€“focused policy development

title: Services
text:
Tailored Partnerships
Every system, community, and organization is unique. CRSCPH offers flexible, tailored partnerships aligned with specific needs, goals, and contexts.
Partnership opportunities include:

Customized research and evaluation projects
Long-term strategic partnerships
Collaborative grant development
Capacity-building cohorts or institutes
Pilot projects and innovation initiatives
